items.texto: The Solar System is like a big family in space. At the center, we have the Sun, a bright and hot star. Orbiting around the Sun are eight planets, including our Earth. The closest planets to the Sun are Mercury, Venus, Earth, and Mars. They are called the "rocky" or "terrestrial" planets. Farther out, we have the "gas giants": Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Besides planets, there are also moons, asteroids, and comets in our Solar System. All of these objects travel in paths called orbits.
